title: Hebrew (1890) Triglot Bible (Heb Greek Latin)
description:
The 1890 "Triglot Bible," published by R.D. Dickinson, is a comprehensive compilation of the Holy Scriptures, presenting the Old and New Testaments in their original tongues. This unique edition includes the Hebrew text of the Old Testament, the Greek text of the New Testament, the Greek Septuagint (an ancient Greek translation of the Hebrew Bible), the Syriac version of the New Testament, and the Latin Vulgate version. All these texts are thoughtfully arranged in parallel columns for ease of comparative study and analysis.

The Triglot Bible's integration of multiple translations and versions into a single volume offers a unique resource for biblical scholars, theologians, and students. It facilitates an in-depth understanding of the textual variations and interpretations of biblical scriptures across different languages and traditions. The inclusion of a complete prolegomenon adds scholarly context to this edition, making the Triglot Bible a significant tool for those engaged in biblical studies and the history of biblical interpretation.
